resources.description: Medical Imaging shows people the morphology of the body's internal organs function intuitive ly. Electrical Impedance Tomography (EIT) is an emerging medical imaging technology. It has the advantages of simple structure, low cost, non-radiological hazards and non-invasive . EIT can not only take advantage of the impedance differences between the different organizations reconstruction of anatomical images, and cantissues and organs to achieve functional imaging impedance changes in different physiological and pathological state, and is suitable for long -term monitoring. The solution is approximate due to t he ill -posedness of inverse problem . Because the image is accuracy and computation of contradictions in not quick enough, EIT is still unable to meet the requirements of practical pplication. By using regression analysis algorithm , Node-Mapping Method only calculates the node potential . The speed of operation and the reconstructed image quality have been greatly improved.
resources.name: Node-Mapping EIT Method Based on Regression Analysis

name: node-mapping-eit-method-based-on-regression-analysis
notes:
Medical Imaging shows people the morphology of the body's internal organs function intuitive ly. Electrical Impedance Tomography (EIT) is an emerging medical imaging technology. It has the advantages of simple structure, low cost, non-radiological hazards and non-invasive . EIT can not only take advantage of the impedance differences between the different organizations reconstruction of anatomical images, and cantissues and organs to achieve functional imaging impedance changes in different physiological and pathological state, and is suitable for long -term monitoring. The solution is approximate due to t he ill -posedness of inverse problem . Because the image is accuracy and computation of contradictions in not quick enough, EIT is still unable to meet the requirements of practical pplication. By using regression analysis algorithm , Node-Mapping Method only calculates the node potential . The speed of operation and the reconstructed image quality have been greatly improved.
http://www.ivypub.org/bf/paperInfo.aspx?ID=2532
title: Node-Mapping EIT Method Based on Regression Analysis
